Exception requires API level 17 (current min is 17): `android.view.WindowManager.InvalidDisplayException`, and having a surrounding/preceding version check **does not** help since prior to API level 19, just **loading** the class will cause a crash. Consider marking the surrounding class with `RequiresApi(19)` to ensure that the class is never loaded except when on API 19 or higher.
